text: Renée Claude (July 3, 1939 – May 12, 2020) was a Canadian actress and pop singer. She was born in Montreal, Quebec.Denise Ménard, Suzanne Thomas and Benoît L'Herbier, "Renée Claude". The Canadian Encyclopedia, January 20, 2010. She was best known for singing translated songs by Stéphane Venne, Michel Conte, Georges Brassens and Léo Ferré. An actress, she starred in It's Your Turn, Laura Cadieux, Avec un grand A and in He Shoots, He Scores. In 2019, Claude was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease."Renée Claude souffre de la maladie d’Alzheimer". Le Journal de Montréal, February 7, 2019. She died of COVID-19 in Montreal on May 12, 2020 at the age of 80.La chanteuse Renée Claude emportée par la COVID-19 à l’âge de 80 ans ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1939 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Montreal Category:People with Alzheimer's disease Category:Canadian movie actors Category:Canadian television actors Category:Canadian pop singers Category:Actors from Montreal
title: Renée Claude
